sen.j: 科野国造（しなののくにのみやつこ・しなのこくぞう)は信濃国を支配した国造。
sen.e: Shinanonokuninomiyatsuko (also known as Shinanokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled Shinano Province.
Shinano no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Shinanokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Shinano Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Shinano no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Shinanokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Shinano Province.

sen.j: 神武天皇の子の神八井耳命が祖で、成務天皇朝にその孫の五百建命が科野国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: Kanyaimiminomikoto, a son of Emperor Jinmu, was the ancestor of the clan and Iotake, a grandson of Kanyaimiminomikoto, was appointed Shinanonokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
Kanyaimimi no mikoto, a son of Emperor Jinmu, was the ancestor of the clan and Iotake, a grandson of Kanyaimimi no mikoto, was appointed Shinanonokuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: 後に金刺氏で朝臣を賜る者もいた。
sen.e: Later, some of the descendants of the Kanesashi clan were conferred on Asomi.

sen.j: 信濃国や駿河国で郡司を務めるものも多かった。

sen.j: 外従五位下に叙せられ、連姓を賜った。
